job_title: Director of Employer Engagement in Leicester, England
pros: I joined in April 2021 and have, and continue to see, many positive changes which ultimately lead to positive outcomes for our learners and employers. The organisation works well externally but as importantly internally where much cross college collaborative team work is undertaken. Work / life balance is highly encouraged as is ensuring we all feel valued - which is not easily achieved in the education sector...
cons: Recruiting for the sector is often a challenge and we need to get better at raising our profile and demonstrate how rewarding it can to work in education, especially at SMB.

review_title: A really supportive place to work with fantastic staff.
job_title: Marketing Team Leader in Hinckley, England
pros: My role has continually grown in scope and responsibility since I started, with lots of support from my Manager to develop as a professional in my field. Fantastic learning facilities and beautiful campuses - all with their own unique feel and specialisms. Great benefits (good holiday allowance, pension scheme, free parking at all campuses). Fellow staff members are friendly, supportive and make work feel like such a nice place to be every day. The Marketing team in particular is such a welcoming and supportive team, where everyone's ideas are taken on board with enthusiasm. No two days are the same - there's so much variety and so many different sectors to learn about. The flexibility to work across three different campuses also keeps my work life really interesting. The college values really resonate with me - Resilient, Ambitious, Innovative, Sustainable, Ethical and Excellent (R.A.I.S.E.)
cons: I can't think of many (if any!) cons! Sometimes the WiFi can be difficult at the Brooksby Campus - but this minor con comes with the unique benefit of working in a stunning 16th century manor house!
